box2d

Class B2DBody

  • java.lang.Object
    • box2d.B2DBody

  • public class B2DBody
extends java.lang.Object
    The B2DBody class contains methods and templates for an easy setup process of a Body instance and scanning methods to get its properties.

    During setup you can define all its physical properties such as its shape, density and friction as well as its location and rotation.

    Once the B2DBody is created in a World the setup settings are locked while the scanning methods for its current location, rotation and other properties are unlocked.

    For more information about the Box2D physics engine read the official Box2D manual or consult the Box2D API

    • Field Detail

      • body

        private org.jbox2d.dynamics.Body body
        The Body instance which is setup by the B2DBody class. All the properties are save in this instance with the help of BodyDef, FixtureDef and other sub-classes. This instance is then initialised in a World in which its physical processes are calculated.

      • bodyDef

        private org.jbox2d.dynamics.BodyDef bodyDef
        The BodyDef is used to setup the B2DBody class. Properties such as rotation and location of the Body as well as the BodyType (static, dynamic,...) are specified inhere.

      • fixtureDef

        private org.jbox2d.dynamics.FixtureDef fixtureDef
        The fixtureDef if used to setup the B2DBody class. Properties such as density and friction of the Body are specified inhere.

      • polygonShape

        private org.jbox2d.collision.shapes.PolygonShape polygonShape
        The PolygonShape is used to setup a rectangle or an polygon. It defines the shape of the Body as a set of vertices.

      • circleShape

        private org.jbox2d.collision.shapes.CircleShape circleShape
        The CircleShape is used to setup a circle. It defines the size of the Body with a radius given.

      • dimensions

        private org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 dimensions
        The dimensions Vec2 contains the values for the dimensions of the B2DBody for rendering purposes. Due to the lack of a scanning-method in the Box2D physics engine those values have to be saved separately.

      • shapeType

        private ShapeType shapeType
        shapeType holds the information about what shape this B2DBody is as an enum ShapeType.

      • drawColor

        private javafx.scene.paint.Color drawColor
        drawColor specifies the Color in which the B2DBody is rendered. The colour is applied to both the frame and the filling (if enabled).

      • drawFill

        private boolean drawFill
        drawFill specifies whether the B2DBody is rendered filled or as a frame.

      • isCreated

        private boolean isCreated
        isCreated holds the status of the B2DBody. Its default value is false. That enables all the methods for setting up a B2DBody. Once the B2DBody is created with createBody() isCreated is set to false. This disables all the value-setting methods but therefore enables scanning methods. As by now it is not possible to switch back to the setup-mode.

      • defaultBodyType

        private static org.jbox2d.dynamics.BodyType defaultBodyType
        defaultBodyType defines the default BodyType of a B2DBody instance. This value can be overwritten with setBodyType().

      • name

        private final java.lang.String name
        Each B2DBody can be given an identification string. This can be used for later recognition of a particular B2DBody instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • B2DBody

        public B2DBody(java.lang.String name_in)
        Initialises a new B2DBody and sets the default values. Takes a string for identification.
        Parameters:
        name_in - Gives this instance a final name.

    • Method Detail

      • setDefalutValues

        public void setDefalutValues()
        Sets all properties available to a reasonable default value to avoid NullPointerException

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

      • setDefaultBodyDef

        public void setDefaultBodyDef()
        Sets bodyDef to default values. Location, rotation, BodyType and velocity are set.

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

      • setDefaultPolygon

        public void setDefaultPolygon()
        Gives polygonShape a default cube shape with radius 0.1m.

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

      • setDefaultFixture

        public void setDefaultFixture()
        Sets fixtureDef to default values. Density, friction and restitution of the B2DBody are set.

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

      • setDefaultPaint

        public void setDefaultPaint()
        Sets the default rendering Color to blue.

      • setBodyDef

        public void setBodyDef(org.jbox2d.dynamics.BodyDef bodyDef_in)
        Takes properties such as location, rotation, BodyType and velocity in form of a BodyDef and applies those values to the B2DBody.

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        bodyDef_in - Specifies the BodyDef for the B2DBody

      • setPolygonShape

        public void setPolygonShape(org.jbox2d.collision.shapes.PolygonShape polygonShape_in,
                            org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 dimensions_in)
        Takes the shape of polygonShape_in and applies it to the B2DBody. Dimensions have to be calculated beforehand to match the PolygonShape provided with it.

        NOTE: This type of shape has not been implemented in the render engine yet, so using this method might lead to display errors!

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        polygonShape_in - Sets the vertex-shape if the B2DBody
        dimensions_in - Sets the total size of the shape

      • setRectShape

        public void setRectShape(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 dimensions_in)
        Takes a dimensions Vec2 and creates a rectangle shape. The x and the y parts of dimensions specify half of the rectangles width and height (in metres).

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        dimensions_in - Sets the radii of the rectangle (in metres)

      • setCircleShape

        public void setCircleShape(float radius_in)
        Takes a float and creates a circle/ball shape. The radius of this B2DBody instance is set to radius_in (in metres).

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        radius_in - Sets the radius of the circle/ball.

      • setFixture

        public void setFixture(org.jbox2d.dynamics.FixtureDef fixtureDef_in)
        Takes properties such as density, friction and restitution in form of a FixtureDef and applies those values to this B2DBody instance.

        NOTE: The Shape included in fixtureDef_in will be overwritten with local Shape! Use setPolygonShape() or setCircleShape() to avoid this problem.

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        fixtureDef_in - Specifies the FixtureDef for the B2DBody

      • setBodyType

        public void setBodyType(org.jbox2d.dynamics.BodyType bodyType_in)
        Specifies what type this B2DBody instance is. Takes a BodyType enum:
        • DYNAMIC: Body is affected by gravity; falls and collides
        • STATIC: Body is not affected by physics but collides with other (KINEMATIC) bodies
        • KINETIC: Body is not affected by physics but it's movement can be controlled and it collides with other (KINEMATIC) bodies.

        Default value: DYNAMIC

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        bodyType_in - Specifies the BodyType of the B2DBody

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in)
        Takes a Vec2 and sets the location of this B2DBody instance.The coordinates are given in metres.

        Default value: 0m, 0m

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        pos_in - sets the position of the B2DBody

      • setAngle

        public void setAngle(float rad_in)
        Takes a float and sets the rotation of this B2DBody instance. The rotation is given in radiant counterclockwise around the centre point.

        Default value: 0 rad

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        rad_in - sets the rotation of the B2DBody in radiant

      • setLinearVelocity

        public void setLinearVelocity(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 vel_in)
        Takes a Vec2 and sets the velocity of this B2DBody instance. The velocity is given in metres/second.

        Default value: 0 m/s, 0m/s

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        vel_in - sets the velocity of the B2DBody

      • setAngularVelocity

        public void setAngularVelocity(float vel_in)
        Takes a float and sets the angular velocity of this B2DBody instance. The velocity is given in radiant/second counterclockwise.

        Default value: 0.0 rad/s

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        vel_in - sets the angular velocity of the B2DBody

      • setBullet

        public void setBullet(boolean bullet_in)
        Takes a boolean and sets the bulletProperty of this B2DBody instance to the given value. It increases number of iterations when calculating its movements and prevents those bodies from passing through one another when set to true. This is recommended for fast-moving objects.

        Default value: false

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        bullet_in - sets the bulletProperty of the B2DBody

      • setDensity

        public void setDensity(float dens_in)
        Takes a float and sets the density of this B2DBody instance. A higher value makes the B2DBody heavier. The overall weight is calculated by multiplying the density with the area of the shape of the B2DBody.

        Default value: 1.0f

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        dens_in - sets the density of the B2DBody

      • setFriction

        public void setFriction(float fric_in)
        Takes a float and sets the friction of this B2DBody instance to the value given. A higher value increases the fiction between this B2DBody and its collision partner.

        Default value: 0.3f

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        fric_in - sets the friction of the B2DBody

      • setRestitution

        public void setRestitution(float rest_in)
        Takes a float and sets the resitiution of this B2DBody instance. By giving a higher value the bounciness of the B2DBody increases. For perfectly elastic collisions let this value be 0.9875f. Values below this are partial-elastic collisions, values above this make the collision "over-elastic".

        Default value: 0.5f

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        rest_in - value between 0.0f and 1.0f defines the bounciness of the B2DBody

      • setGroupIndex

        public void setGroupIndex(int ind_in)
        Takes an int and assigns this B2DBody instance to a group. Only instances with the same group index are interacting with each other.

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        ind_in - assigns this B2DBody instance to a group.

      • setUpRect

        public void setUpRect(float pos_x,
                      float pos_y,
                      float dim_x,
                      float dim_y,
                      float rad_in,
                      org.jbox2d.dynamics.BodyType bodyType_in)
        Simple setup-method for a rectangle. Takes all the information necessary and handles all the trouble for you. The position and dimensions are handed over as individual float values, x part followed by the y part. All the values can still be modified with the set-value-methods.
        dim_x and dim_y specify half of the rectangles width and height (in metres).

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        pos_x - sets the x position of the B2DBody rectangle
        pos_y - sets the y position of the B2DBody rectangle
        dim_x - sets half the height of the B2DBody rectangle
        dim_y - sets half the width of the B2DBody rectangle
        rad_in - sets the rotation of the B2DBody
        bodyType_in - specifies the BodyType of the B2DBody

      • setUpRect

        public void setUpRect(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in,
                      org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 dim_in,
                      float rad_in,
                      org.jbox2d.dynamics.BodyType bodyType_in)
        Simple setup-method for a rectangle. Takes all the information necessary and handles all the trouble for you. The position and dimensions are handed over as Vec2 vectors. All the values can still be modified with the set-value-methods.
        The x and the y parts of dim_in specify half of the rectangles width and height (in metres).

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        pos_in - sets the centre position of the B2DBody rectangle
        dim_in - sets the radii of the B2DBody rectangle
        rad_in - sets the rotation of the B2DBody in radiant
        bodyType_in - specifies the BodyType of the B2DBody

      • setUpCircle

        public void setUpCircle(float pos_x,
                        float pos_y,
                        float dim,
                        float rad_in,
                        org.jbox2d.dynamics.BodyType bodyType_in)
        Simple setup-method for a circle. Takes all the information necessary and handles all the trouble for you. The position is handed over as individual float values, x part followed by the y part. All the values can still be modified with the set-value-methods.

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        pos_x - sets the x position of the B2DBody circle
        pos_y - sets the y position of the B2DBody circle
        dim - sets the radius of the B2DBody circle
        rad_in - sets the rotation of the B2DBody
        bodyType_in - specifies the BodyType of the B2DBody

      • setUpCircle

        public void setUpCircle(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in,
                        float dim_in,
                        float rad_in,
                        org.jbox2d.dynamics.BodyType bodyType_in)
        Simple setup-method for a circle. Takes all the information necessary and handles all the trouble for you. The position is handed over as a Vec2 vector. All the values can still be modified with the set-value-methods.

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        pos_in - sets the centre position of the B2DBody circle
        dim_in - sets the radius of the B2DBody circle
        rad_in - sets the rotation of the B2DBody
        bodyType_in - specifies the BodyType of the B2DBody

      • setUpPoint

        public void setUpPoint(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in)
        Simple setup for only a point without a body. Takes only a position Vec2 vector. Default BodyType is STATIC, so it can be used as an anchor.

        This method can only be accessed before this B2DBody instance has been created with createBody()

        Parameters:
        pos_in - sets the position of the B2DBody point

      • setColor

        public void setColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color c_in)
        Takes a Color and makes it the rendering colour for this B2DBody instance. The colour is applied to both the frame and the filling. This property is only used by the render-class.

        Default value: BLUE

        Parameters:
        c_in - sets the rendering colour for the B2DBody

      • setFill

        public void setFill(boolean fill_in)
        Takes a boolean which tells the renderer-class, whether to fill this B2DBody instance when rendering.

        Default value: false

        Parameters:
        fill_in - sets the fill-property of the B2DBody

      • createBody

        public void createBody(org.jbox2d.dynamics.World world)
        Initialises this B2DBody with the previously set values in the given World. Once a had been created, it is not possible to use the setup-methods make any changes. The B2DBody instance is now being moved according to the physics in the World. Scanner-methods are enabled by calling this method to get position and rotation values of the B2DBody instance.

        Make sure you have set all values before calling this method!

        Parameters:
        world - reference to the World in which this B2DBody instance should be created in.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Removes all references to this B2DBody instance from the World it had been created in.

      • isCreated

        public boolean isCreated()
        Gives the status of this B2DBody instance. If true the B2DBody had already been created in a World and is (probably) being calculated, scanning-methods are enabled- When false the properties of this B2DBody instance can still be modified and it has yet to created with createBody()
        Returns:
        B2DBody is initialised in a World

      • getPos

        public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 getPos()
        Gives a Vec2 vector of the current position of this B2DBody instance.
        Returns:
        the current position vector of the B2DBody

      • getDim

        public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 getDim()
        Gives a Vec2 vector of the dimensions of this B2DBody instance.
        Returns:
        the dimension vector of the B2DBody

      • getAngle

        public float getAngle()
        Gives the float of the current rotation of this B2DBody instance. The rotation is given in radiant counterclockwise.
        Returns:
        the current rotation of the B2DBody

      • getShapeType

        public ShapeType getShapeType()
        Gives the ShapeType enum of this B2DBody instance. It used for rendering purposes.
        Returns:
        the ShapeType of this B2DBody

      • getColor

        public javafx.scene.paint.Color getColor()
        Gives the Color value of this B2DBody instance. It used for rendering purposes.
        Returns:
        the Color of this B2DBody

      • getBody

        public org.jbox2d.dynamics.Body getBody()
        Gives a reference of the Body of this B2DBody instance. Only use this method if you are aware of what you are doing.
        Returns:
        a reference of the Body instance of the B2DBody

      • getFill

        public boolean getFill()
        Gives the drawFill of this B2DBody instance. It returns true when the B2DBody should be rendered with a filling.
        Returns:
        drawFill boolean

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the String given during initialisation of this B2DBody instance.
        Returns:
        name of the B2DBody
